sanskrit_verse:
यत्चास्य सुकृतं किं चिदमुत्रार्थमुपार्जितम् ।
भर्ता तत्सर्वमादत्ते परावृत्तहतस्य तु ॥ ७.९५॥
transliteration:
yat cāsya sukṛtaṁ kiṁ cid amutrārtham upārjitam |
bhartā tatsarvam ādatte parāvṛtta-hatasya tu || 7.95 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Whatever merit a woman has earned in this life or the next through her actions, the husband assumes it all; however, when he turns away or dies, that accumulated merit returns to her.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows through relational alignment and conscious union
Causation is transferred through intentional energetic bonding
Capacity-based responsibility shifts with the presence or absence of active guardianship
Restoration logic ensures no loss of spiritual asset upon dissolution of union
Consciousness alignment maintains continuity of karmic ownership
executable_legal_axioms: IF (union_exists == TRUE AND guardian_present == TRUE) THEN (karmic_assets_transferred_to_guardian = TRUE)
IF (union_dissolved == TRUE OR guardian_absent == TRUE) THEN (karmic_assets_revert_to_owner = TRUE)
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating familial or marital disputes involving spiritual or karmic entitlements, the court must recognize that authority over another's merits is conditional upon the integrity and continuity of the dharmic bond. Upon its lawful termination or collapse, all assumed spiritual assets revert automatically without need for litigation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that karmic causality operates through conscious alignment, not possession. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that when alignment ceases, so does transfer. Responsibility lies in maintaining alignment, not controlling outcomes. There is no punitive consequence—only natural reversion based on the cessation of cause.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion process for dissolved unions: automatic release of all assumed karmic assets
Responsibility assumption protocol: husband must consciously uphold union to retain access
Capacity restoration mechanism: woman regains full karmic autonomy upon bond severance
Integrity reintegration: both parties realign with individual svadharma post-dissolution
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands declared: Dharma flows through conscious alignment, not domination. All karmic assets revert naturally upon the end of union. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
